intro: Platystemon communis, commonly known as the common platystemon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and fern-like leaves. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Platystemon communis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
